OOC on the bottom. To LN especially.





::Slayer::





Slayer speeds up, flying past Maximal City now. He knew that all the scanners there could detect him, but he really didn't care at the moment.


~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~


OOC:





LN, the energy required to push a missile up from the bottom of the ocean ot anywhere would probably be able to power Manhatton (yeah, I spelled it wrong, oh well) for several years. Having your base that far down under is a tradeoff I guess. I toned your weapons list down without realizing the depth, but with all the complaints I've been getting I think a good tradeoff (and physically possible) would be to have almost no defences since its that far down.



Also, LN, the council's been recieving complaints about you acting like a council member. You've been telling members what they can and cannot do, and you've made quite alot of people's RPGing experience much worse. Please stop this instantly. The council has the job of policeing the RPG, and we'll call a mode if we see it. Until such a time when you are on the council, though, please refrain from attempting to moderate the RPG.




--- In nbwrpg@y..., "CYBERWOLF4" <cyberwolf4@p...> wrote:


> Ignatius looked up still wondering how he'd got beaten on this badly. He


> didn't want Slayer confused or suspicious since he remembered the shootout


> the two had recently had. "Whatever you say." he wanted to be safe but knew


> that he wouldn't be safe until he was back to 100 percent.
